title: ADHD-Friendly Meal Planning
description: A meal planning and food management routine designed for ADHD brains. Uses executive function supports, sensory-friendly approaches, and habit stacking to make meal planning sustainable and reduce decision fatigue.

setupSteps.question: What's your biggest food-related challenge? (meal planning, grocery shopping, cooking, food waste, or all of the above)
What time of day do you have the most energy for food-related tasks?
How many meals do you want to plan for each week? (Start small - 3-5 is perfect!)
What's your preferred grocery shopping method? (in-store, online delivery, pickup, or a mix)
What's one food you always enjoy eating? (This will be your 'safe food' for when planning feels overwhelming)

steps.message: üçΩÔ∏è Meal planning time! Let's work with your ${mainFoodChallenge} challenge using ADHD-friendly strategies.
üìù Brain dump: Write down 3-5 foods you've enjoyed recently (no pressure to cook them, just capture what you like)
üéØ Choose ONE meal to plan for this week (breakfast, lunch, or dinner - pick the easiest one)
üìã Simple planning: Pick 2-3 options for your chosen meal (include ${safeFood} as one option)
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm taking care of my body!' (dopamine reward for your ADHD brain)
üçΩÔ∏è Meal planning and shopping time! Your brain is learning that food management can be simple and satisfying.
üìù Quick meal review: Look at your previous plans and pick 2-3 meals that worked well
üõí Shopping list creation: Write down ingredients for your chosen meals (keep it simple!)
üì± Set up ${shoppingMethod} for tomorrow (or schedule it for when you have energy)
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm making food decisions easier for my ADHD brain!'
üçΩÔ∏è Meal planning, shopping, and cooking time! Time to add food preparation to your routine.
üç≥ Cooking prep: Choose ONE meal to prep ahead (cook once, eat multiple times)
üì¶ Food storage planning: Think about how to store leftovers to make future meals easier
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm building a sustainable food system for my ADHD brain!'

effect.message: üß† ADHD Brain Science: You're reducing decision fatigue by planning ahead! Your executive function is learning that food decisions can be made when you have energy, not when you're hungry and overwhelmed.
üöÄ Three weeks of meal planning! Your brain has formed the basic habit loop. Ready to add grocery shopping to your routine?
üõí Week 4! Time to integrate grocery shopping with your meal planning. Your ADHD brain is ready to take the next step!
üéâ Your ADHD brain is loving this approach! You've successfully made meal planning and shopping sustainable. Ready to add cooking and food management?
üç≥ Week 8! Time to add cooking and food management to your routine. Your ADHD brain is ready to build a complete food system!

effect.taskDescription: Create your personalized meal planning toolkit: list your favorite easy recipes, grocery stores, and food prep strategies that work for your ADHD brain

effect.message: üí° ADHD Tip: Remember, the goal is to make food decisions easier, not perfect. If planning feels overwhelming, fall back to your ${safeFood} - that's why we included it!
